html: Although Jehovah does contend and get angry with his people when they transgress, he doesn’t do so “forever” or “always” as all are not on the same spiritual level (Isaiah 12:1; 10:25; 60:10; 64:9). Because he deals with people according to what they are empowered to endure, he expects more from those in higher categories than from those lower. And yet, when people’s wickedness reaches a surfeit, as it did before the Flood, his spirit ceases to strive with man and his judgments follow (Genesis 6:1-13; cf. Isaiah 54:9; 63:1-6). Jehovah suspends his mercy until his justice achieves the desired effect.
